page.title: 13THE CHANGING SCENE
page.content: Nellie Miller,a 78 year old Glaswegian has lived in Stromness for 58 years. She married into the Miller family who have lived in the same house since 1716.Her nephew, another Miller, will inherit the house. She remembers lots of shops that are no longer shops or which have changed ownership and type of stock.In the past many shops had a mixture of everything. She remembers the present British Legion as some kind of stables, and a warehouse once occupied the Ferry Inn car park. She has noticed the changing fashions too and how styles from her young days eg mutton chop sleeves are now worn by Stromness girls. Despite changes in town and clothes, her decided view of Stromness is that there "isn't a bonnier place."
